reviews.review_msg: One of the best professors I've ever had. Great dude!

David is very passionate and will ramble on during lectures. I did not find attendance in lectures to be critical but I still went. Your grade consists of three tests but everything is directly from the textbook. The short answer is where most lost marks on because you need to detail your answers which some are not prepared to do. Read the text!

I'm not sure why David has such excellent ratings; personally, I wouldn't recommend taking this class because the grade is dependent only on three tests. To perform well on the examinations, you must know every detail from the textbook, which is very time consuming.

Honestly, you can tell the prof is passionate about what he's teaching, but maybe too much... He rambles a lot in lectures, 3 hours that could easily be condensed into 1.5 hours. The entire course is based off of 2 midterms (25% each) and a final (50%), but if you study hard and really dive into the textbook, its pretty easy to get a good grade
He is very understanding and responds to your questions very fast through email. Seem like a prof that really cares about his students. Would take a course with him again.

This class is ok. Dr. Cox tends to ramble in lectures which makes it hard to maintain focus and interest. Exams tested on a lot of material. It's definitely possible to do well on them, but not without a significant amount of effort. Overall, its a low maintenance course, as the exams are the only assessments, but definitely not easy or GPA booster
He's kinda old school, but really passionate and cares about the students. All exam based, so study hard. Always available to help after class hours.

Martin is 100% amazing. He is like no other psych prof- he is honest, hilarious, and engaging. He ACTUALLY CARES about teaching! You definitely cannot miss a class (no textbook) and make sure to write good notes because his tests are tough- the questions really challenge your knowledge and comprehension. If you can take a course with him, DO IT!
